# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str, text_width = 10)
    words = split(input_str, ' ') # Split into words
    wrapped_lines = []

    for word in words
        line_content = "$word "

        # Check if the line would exceed the width
        if length(line_content) > text_width
            # Add a new line and start the next word on a new line
            wrapped_lines += ["\n", line_content[1:text_width]]]
            line_content = ""
        end

        # Append the remaining part of the word, or an empty string if no more words are left
        push!(wrapped_lines, line_content))
    end

    return join(wrapped_lines, "\n"))
end

# Example usage:
input_str = "This is a test string with many words to wrap."
wrapped_output = wrap_string(input_str)
println(wrapped_output)
```

In this example, the input string is wrapped to fit within a maximum text width of 10 characters. The output will display each wrapped line on a new line.
